Detailed Description

An abstraction to common data and functions found in flows, lines and projects.

The data is things like author, help stuff, filename, etc. See methods below for more info.

GeoXmlFlow, GeoXmlLine and GeoXmlProject XML files can all be loaded using geoxml_document_load. Validation is done automatically by matching document's DTD, located in /usr/share/libgeoxml (specifically at ${datarootdir}/libgeoxml, run '--configure --help' for more information). The same occurs with all methods in this class: they are valid for all GeoXmlDocument's derived classes. Use GEOXML_DOC to cast.

Define Documentation

#define GEOXML_DOCUMENT ( x   )     ((GeoXmlDocument*)(x))

Cast to GeoXmlDocument's from its derived classes: GeoXmlFlow, GeoXmlLine and GeoXmlProject.

#define GEOXML_DOC ( x   )     GEOXML_DOCUMENT(x)

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct geoxml_document GeoXmlDocument

The GeoXmlDocument struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE

Document type: flow, line or project.

Enumerator:
GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE_FLOW  The document is a GeoXmlFlow.
GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE_LINE  The document is a GeoXmlLine.
GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE_PROJECT  The document is a GeoXmlProject.

Function Documentation

int geoxml_document_load ( GeoXmlDocument **  document,
const gchar *  path 
)

Load a document XML file at path into document.

The document is validated using the proper DTD. Invalid documents are not loaded.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_NO_MEMORY, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_FILE, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_DOCUMENT, GEOXML_RETV_DTD_SPECIFIED, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_DTD

int geoxml_document_load_buffer ( GeoXmlDocument **  document,
const gchar *  xml 
)

Load a document XML buffer at xml into document.

The document is validated using the proper DTD. Invalid documents are not loaded.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_NO_MEMORY, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_FILE, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_DOCUMENT, GEOXML_RETV_DTD_SPECIFIED, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_DTD

void geoxml_document_free ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Free the memory used by the GeoXmlDocument's XML structure.

If document is NULL nothing is done.

GeoXmlDocument* geoxml_document_clone ( GeoXmlDocument *  source  ) 

Create an identical copy of source and returns it.

If source is NULL nothing is done.

enum GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE geoxml_document_get_type ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Return the type of document.

If document is NULL, GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE_FLOW is returned

See also:
GEOXML_DOCUMENT_TYPE

const gchar* geoxml_document_get_version ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Returns the version string of document.

Note that it can vary between flows, lines and projects, as not all change version between libgeoxml versions.

If document is NULL nothing is done.

int geoxml_document_validate ( const gchar *  filename  ) 

Validate the document specified in filename.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_NO_MEMORY, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_FILE, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_DOCUMENT, GEOXML_RETV_DTD_SPECIFIED, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_DTD

If filename is NULL, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_FILE is returned.

int geoxml_document_save ( GeoXmlDocument *  document,
const gchar *  path 
)

Save document to path.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_CANT_ACCESS_FILE,

If document is NULL nothing is done.

int geoxml_document_to_string ( GeoXmlDocument *  document,
gchar **  xml_string 
)

Save document to xml_string.

Memory needed for xml_string is allocated. Therefore, you should free it at the approtiate time.

If document is NULL nothing is done.

void geoxml_document_set_filename ( GeoXmlDocument *  document,
const gchar *  filename 
)

Set the filename of document to filename which is its correct name in the filesystem.

If document is NULL nothing is done.

See also:

void geoxml_document_set_description ( GeoXmlDocument *  document,
const gchar *  description 
)

Set a brief description of the document, usually an one line text.

Only plain text is accepted. See 'geoxml_document_set_help' and 'geoxml_document_get_help'

If document is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_document_get_description

void geoxml_document_set_help ( GeoXmlDocument *  document,
const gchar *  help 
)

Set a help associated with help equal to help.

It can be both a plain text or an HTML text. This enables rich text documentation of the document with all the functionallity of html, like images, tables, fonts, etc. PS: Because of implementation HTML text in help cannot contain the string ']]>', as it is stored in a CDATA Section. If those strings are found they are going to be replaced by ']] >'.

If document is NULL nothing is done.

See also:
geoxml_document_get_help

const gchar* geoxml_document_get_filename ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Get the filename of document as it should correctly be named in the filesystem.

If document is NULL returns NULL.

See also:
geoxml_document_set_filename

If document is NULL returns NULL.

Get the document 's last modification date.

If document is NULL returns NULL.

See also:

const gchar* geoxml_document_get_description ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Get a brief description of the document, usually an one line text.

No html is allowed here. See 'geoxml_document_set_help' and 'geoxml_document_get_help'

If document is NULL returns NULL.

See also:
geoxml_document_set_description

const gchar* geoxml_document_get_help ( GeoXmlDocument *  document  ) 

Returns the help associated with this document.

It can be a plain text or a HTML format. This enables rich text documentation of the document with all the functionallity of html, like images, tables, fonts, etc.

If document is NULL returns NULL.

See also:
geoxml_document_set_help
